articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Reactions to the Budget, which saw large rises in both tax and public spending, lead the papers.
articles.title: Newspaper headlines: 'Reeves' £40bn tax gamble' and 'bombshell for Britain's strivers'

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: People tell the BBC how much they earn and what they made of the Budget.
articles.title: 'We earn £100,000. We are not worse off after the Budget'

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The government's fate will depend on whether it can make things better, says political editor Chris Mason.
articles.title: Chris Mason: A change-making Budget and a moment of jeopardy

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Spain is enduring its worst flooding disaster in decades, with at least 95 people dead and dozens more missing.
articles.title: Spain battles deadliest flooding disaster in decades as death toll rises

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The launch comes at a time of deteriorating relations between the two Koreas.
articles.title: North Korea fires suspected intercontinental ballistic missile

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The chancellor unveils £40bn in tax rises in her first Budget but tells the BBC it should be a one-off.
articles.title: This is not a Budget we want to repeat, says Rachel Reeves

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: As a ban on protesting within 150m of abortion clinics is introduced, the BBC speaks to anti-abortion activists.
articles.title: My afternoon with protesters who stand outside abortion clinics

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Chancellor Rachel Reeves will set out the government's financial plans for the next year.
articles.title: When is the Budget and what might be in it?

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Emergency services were called to Tregoad Holiday Park, near Looe, on Wednesday evening.
articles.title: Looe: Eight believed to be injured in land train incident

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Regulated rail fares in England are set to rise by 4.6%, while most rail cards will rise by £5.
articles.title: Budget 2024: Rail fares in England and railcard costs to increase
